data: Clear and brilliant in their blue and white are these shining northern skies; and the winds that come blowing over the moorland are honey-scented from the heather; and the wide waters of the loch are all of a ruffled and shimmering silver, with a thin fringe of foam along the curving bays.
browsing: culture/civilization/society|browsing: literature|browsing: fiction|category: romance|category: novels|category: british literature
